Monday - Sunday4:30PM- Close
Parking 
Exclusive to our Sorelle guests, we offer complimentary parking in our private parking lot. Available after 5PM, our private parking lot is located at , a short walk from the restaurant. Please note, that availability is limited and not guaranteed.Additional parking can be found via street meter parking or the King & Queen Parking Garage, 85 Queen St Charleston, SC 29401.

[Page Title: Sorelle | Italian Restaurant in Charleston, SC]

Home
Main content starts here, tab to start navigating Slide 1 of 5 Slide 2 of 5 Slide 3 of 5 Slide 4 of 5 Slide 5 of 5 hero gallery paused, press to play images slides Playing hero gallery, press to pause images slides 
SI ACCOMODI

SOUTHERN ITALY MEETS SOUTHERN HOSPITALITY at Sorelle, a dining destination like no other on Charleston’s storied Broad Street.

Inspired by Italy’s all-day cafes, abundant markets and rich culinary traditions, Sorelle features a mercato, central bar, wine room, and a grand dining room offering a variety of experiences for every food lover.
Our Story 
Mangiamo

Helmed by Chef Nick Dugan, Sorelle's kitchen offers a modern spin on classic  Southern Italian cuisine made with Lowcountry ingredients, from fresh pastas and wood-fired pizzas to refined seafood dishes. Inspired by Italy’s convivial drinking culture, the cocktail and wine menus feature an extensive collection of Italian spirits and wines that celebrate the diverse regions of the country.
Menus 
Private Dining

Sorelle’s 3rd-floor private dining area offers an intimate experience with a touch of luxury. Designed by Meyer Davis Studios, the interior boasts a ten-person, round, marble dining table with comfortable velvet chairs, a billiards table, and a relaxing lounge area.

Private Dining Room: (10 seated or 25 standing reception)

Full Restaurant Buyout: (60 seated)
Learn More 
Follow Us
@sorelle_chs 
|
88 BROAD ST (843) 974-1575 Reservations Email Signup

Sorelle takes pride in its rotating selection of more than 300 wines that celebrate the finest from Italy and with something for every taste. The program emphasizes wines from Northern and Central Italy, showcasing both well-known and highly acclaimed producers, as well as lesser known producers for guests to discover. Sorelle’s wine list also features several “verticals” of iconic wines, including some dating back to the 1980s.

In addition to benchmark wines from renowned wine regions such as Champagne, Bordeaux, and Burgundy, Sorelle’s wine list includes a unique selection dedicated to wines made outside of Italy using Italian varietals. Wines from California, Washington, Australia, and Argentina can also be found on the curated list. Guests may browse the wine list before your next visit using the button below.

Corkage Fee

$50 each for the first two 750ml bottles, $100 for the 3rd bottle. 3 bottle maximum.

[Page Title: weekly-specials]

Main content starts here, tab to start navigating 
Weekly Mercato Specials
Slide 1 of 2 Slide 2 of 2 hero gallery paused, press to play images slides Playing hero gallery, press to pause images slides 
A new reason to visit the mercato each week. Every Saturday, we introduce a weekly drink and panino special, crafted with seasonal ingredients and inspired by Italian flavors. These limited-time offerings bring a fresh twist to your favorites—stop by to see what’s new and savor the flavors of the moment or follow along on our .

Sorelle takes pride in its rotating selection of more than 300 wines that celebrate the finest from Italy and with something for every taste. The program emphasizes wines from Northern and Central Italy, showcasing both well-known and highly acclaimed producers, as well as lesser known producers for guests to discover. Sorelle’s wine list also features several “verticals” of iconic wines, including some dating back to the 1980s.

In addition to benchmark wines from renowned wine regions such as Champagne, Bordeaux, and Burgundy, Sorelle’s wine list includes a unique selection dedicated to wines made outside of Italy using Italian varietals. Wines from California, Washington, Australia, and Argentina can also be found on the curated list. Guests may browse the wine list before your next visit using the button below.

Corkage Fee

$50 each for the first two 750ml bottles, $100 for the 3rd bottle. 3 bottle maximum.

The program emphasizes wines from Northern and Central Italy, showcasing both well-known and highly acclaimed producers, as well as lesser known producers for guests to discover. Sorelle’s wine list also features several “verticals” of iconic wines, including some dating back to the 1980s.

In addition to benchmark wines from renowned wine regions such as Champagne, Bordeaux, and Burgundy, Sorelle’s wine list includes a unique selection dedicated to wines made outside of Italy using Italian varietals.
